intro: Heteranthocidium rostrans, commonly known as the rostrate heteranthocidium, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Ericaceae. It is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in late spring or early summer. The plant has evergreen foliage with leathery, dark green leaves that are often covered in a fine pubescence. It thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or heathland environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is more commonly encountered in its natural habitat.
